title: 'True Detective' reimagined as a cop rom-com is maybe better than its disastrous second season
text:
Photo: Lacey Terrell, HBO Two detectives (Rachel McAdams and Colin Farrell) from different parts of L.A. County, California, team up on a grisly murder in season two of 'True Detective' on HBO. June, 2015
Two detectives (Rachel McAdams and Colin Farrell) from different... It's true that not many people really liked HBO's "True Detective" this year, but maybe its major flaw was that modern mystery noir just wasn't the right genre for the show. 
Maybe, if that brief fling between Rachel McAdams' Ani Bezzerides and Colin Farrell's Ray Velcoro had taken over as the central plot (was there even a plot to take over this season?), season 2 of "True Detective" might not have been railed for being " drained " and " monotonous ."
As we saw, season two was about the corruption of power and to some extent, addiction. McAdams' Bezzerides suffered from the tight clutches of gambling and Farrell's Velcoro from alcoholism, but what if actually it was all light-hearted and these major character flaws were actually just cute quirks?
